Comments_List: I learned (1) the interpretive techniques and (2) principles of Constitutional Law, and (3) the method to analyze and answer Constitutional Law issues and questions.

Strengths - rigor, develops legal thinking/writing skills 
Weakness - insufficient time for the second paper
Clear expectations. Great organization: readings, lecture videos, and live sessions were well coordinated to cover the material in more than one way and angle.
Yes absolutely. Anyone with any interest in history or political science should take a class with Amar before graduating.
Yes. This course is very useful preparation for law school and politics study/work in general.
Yes. Professor Amar gives you so much of his time. He is an insightful mentor that is not afraid to tell you how you can improve as a scholar of American history and a long-term learner.
